docs.lead_paragraph: The leaders of corporations and other institutions, it turns out, are not always hungry for more information after mistakes are made.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. already spends nearly 16 percent of its gross domestic product on health care and it is almost impossible to know where all that money goes.

docs.lead_paragraph: With no health care structure, H.I.V. drugs can help just so much.

headline.main: Fight Against AIDS: Small Triumphs, Sunny Optimism and Grim Reality
headline.print_headline: Fight Against AIDS: Small Triumphs, Sunny Optimism and Grim Reality

docs.snippet: With no health care structure, H.I.V. drugs can help just so much.

docs.lead_paragraph: Bill, Bill and Melinda dropped into our world for a few days here. It was an unsettling experience, much like coming home from work to find Mr. Gates regrouting your bathroom shower, Mr. Clinton fixing that broken window, and Mrs. Gates cheerily watering the plants. Famous strangers were suddenly all over our turf, up on the podium at the International AIDS Conference talking with fluent enthusiasm about adherence and second-line drugs, microbicides and pre-exposure prophylaxis.

headline.main: Fight Against AIDS: Small Triumphs, Sunny Optimism and Grim Reality

docs.abstract: Dr Abigail Zuger commentary describes how lack of universal health care is one reason that AIDS will continue to exist; says that without structure that provides AIDS patients and others in need with timely and affordable care real cure cannot be managed; drawing (M)
